courses.name: Monogastric Nutrition
courses.description: (same as AN_SCI 7312 and NEP 7020; cross-leveled with AN_SCI 4312 and NEP 4020). Principles of nutrition, feed formulation and recent research in poultry feeding. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Readings in Nutrition
courses.description: Readings in current nutrition research. Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: 15 hours work in field and instructor's consent

courses.name: Nutrition During the Life Cycle
courses.description: Nutritional, physiological and environmental influences on the aging process of man from conception through senescence.

courses.name: Masters Research in Nutrition
courses.description: Investigation in any area of experimental nutrition. Thesis required. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Nutritional Biochemistry of Lipids
courses.description: (same as NEP 8310 and  AN_SCI 8431). Current concepts in the nutritional regulations of lipid metabolism. Emphasis on integrating information and interpreting current research data.

courses.name: Ruminant Nutrition
courses.description: (same as AN_SCI 9432). Physiology, chemistry, microbiology, pathology of ruminants. Emphasizes digestion, absorption, metabolism, utilization of nutrients. Lecture, laboratory, assigned readings.

courses.name: Nutrition in Human Health
courses.description: (same as NEP 8340.) Nutritional aspects of maintaining human health with emphasis on chronic disease prevention. Grades based on classroom participation and four exams.

courses.name: Nutritional Biochemistry of Carbohydrates
courses.description: (same as BIOCHM 8360 and NEP 8360). Current concepts with in-depth coverage of selected examples of key regulatory steps controlling carbohydrate metabolism; emphasizing molecular mechanisms. Based entirely on research literature and taught in a tutorial format.
courses.prerequisites: BIOCHM 4270 and BIOCHM 4272 and 4000-level nutrition course and departmental consent

courses.name: Molecular Biology of Mineral Nutrition
courses.description: (same as BIOCHM 8390 and NEP 8390). Current concepts of metal ion transport, intracellular metal trafficking and metal-dependent regulation of gene expression. Based entirely on research literature and taught in a tutorial format.

courses.name: Nutrient Regulation of Gene Expression
courses.description: (same as AN_SCI 8438, BIOCHM 8438 and NEP 8438). Current concepts with in-depth coverage of several minerals that illustrate themes in molecular mineral nutrition. Based entirely on research literature and taught in a tutorial format.

courses.name: Doctorate Research in Nutrition
courses.description: Investigation in any area of experimental nutrition. Thesis required. Graded on a S/U basis only.
